definition: to move (sth) aside/to step aside/to move over (when sitting on a bench)/to shift (one's gaze)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: He carefully slid the top off the box.
Just move away and I need a place to give away my sneeze first.
sentences.chinese: 挪開去，我需要一個地方先把我的噴嚏送出去。
她迅速地把自行車向後挪開。

sentences.english: That eye, always settle to settle of Ning wear she, a short moments all have never drawn apart.
sentences.chinese: 那雙眼，始終定定的凝着她，片刻都不曾挪開。

sentences.english: Then he hid himself and watched to see if anyone would remove the huge rock.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他藏起來，看是否有人會挪開巨石。

sentences.english: Take away the tables, Nikita Vanya.
sentences.chinese: 尼基塔，萬尼亞，把這些桌子挪開。

sentences.english: Looking away wil signa to your cat that you are weak, and an attack is likely to follow.
sentences.chinese: 挪開視線是示弱的信號，於是它可能會欺負你。

sentences.english: She saw him displace the bar and slip into the garden.
sentences.chinese: 她看見他挪開鐵欄門上的鐵條，鑽到園子裏去。

sentences.english: Then I quickly scoot my chair back and head for the shower.
sentences.chinese: 然後我迅速向後挪開椅子，進浴室洗澡。

sentences.english: He removed some old silk handkerchiefs that were lying on its top and blew away a bit of dust.
sentences.chinese: 他挪開了一些搭在面上的舊的絲巾又吹掉了些灰塵。

sentences.english: Now, move over, you're hogging the bed.
sentences.chinese: 現在，挪開，你一小我私家把牀全佔了。

sentences.english: Not the sun, but only the morning-star shone upon His opening tomb.
sentences.chinese: 沒有太陽，只有晨星發光照在那挪開的墳墓上。

sentences.english: We can at least remove anything idolatrous from our own personal life.
sentences.chinese: 我們至少可以先挪開我們自己個人生活中的偶像。

sentences.english: If you try to keep your other hand away, you will hurt a lot more.
sentences.chinese: 假如你試圖挪開使力的那隻手，你會疼得厲害得多。

sentences.english: If it sets your heart aflutter， I will take away my eyes from your face.
sentences.chinese: 如果它使你心震顫，我就把眼光從你臉上挪開。
